body:
> > i have checked test report 1 and test report 2, it seems like env issue. :) Could you re-run it several times, i suppose that will give us different results.
> 
> What kinds of env issue?

i pick some words from test report, 
 "value": "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Failed to add contact point: cassandra-server\nat com.datastax.driver.core.Cluster$Builder.addContactPoint(Cluster.java:922)\nat test.apache.skywalking.testcase.cassandra.controller.CaseController
i suppose that cassandra server is not ready or it is starting, while test case application access it.

> 2 basic questions
> 
> 1. Why this is optional? I haven't seen 1.8 required.
> 2. Are you doing this because of v1 confliction? If Yes, read the witness class in instrumentation definition. You could use it to separated the plugins, which could be in default plugins at the same time and active when necessary.



> 2 basic questions
> 
> 1. Why this is optional? I haven't seen 1.8 required.
> 2. Are you doing this because of v1 confliction? If Yes, read the witness class in instrumentation definition. You could use it to separated the plugins, which could be in default plugins at the same time and active when necessary.

Ok, I'm going to make some changes
Do you finish your health check API in a real way? That is how you make sure you sever is standing by.

> Do you finish your health check API in a real way? That is how you make sure you sever is standing by.

is there a sample that is health check API to check cassandra database (not server) is ready or not ? or i need to check in my code, ex: loop sleep(1s); database.connect;
There is an API required in your test case, in there, you could use codes to check the target server.
@wu-sheng Can I modify v1's witness class in instrumentation definition  to make the plugin selectively started? Otherwise I can only control whether the v2 plugin starts.

> There is an API required in your test case, in there, you could use codes to check the target server.
ok

@wu-sheng @zhaoyuguang @kezhenxu94 Thanks for your help. I'm working in GrowingIO, we used Skywalking in production help us tracing micro-services.

We  have used Scala building most of our micro-services. So we want to help Scala stacks working on Skywalking in the future (eg. akka-http).

@aiyanbo Look forward to your further contributions. Different companies have different scenarios, which make our ecosystem more stable and powerful. You could send another pull request to add your company and use case into our powered-by page, if you like.
/run ci
Also, if you have interests, could submit a pull request to sync UI changes to this repo. Git submodule update.

> There is an API required in your test case, in there, you could use codes to check the target server.

i update codes, please re-run it again. thanks
@kezhenxu94 Look like `install` breaks the maven env somehow.
@wu-sheng  I have another problem. My local test found that using v1 plugin and kafka-client using 0.11.0.0 also appeared `Magic v1 does not support record headers`.

> > There is an API required in your test case, in there, you could use codes to check the target server.
> 
> i update codes, please re-run it again. thanks

wait a moment

> One question, how does user use this? I think this should link to a UI change. Could you work with @TinyAllen to add this on UI? Topology page or service brief page? Or both?

OK, We will discuss soon or later. CC @TinyAllen

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/8/stone-wlg/testReport-master-2019-08-29-16-02.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/256/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-29-16-02.log)

> Here is the [test report](https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/8/stone-wlg/testReport-master-2019-08-29-16-02.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/256/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-29-16-02.log)

Hi, i update config, this time i will test 3.7.2 and 3.7.1 at first, later i will test 3.7.0 and 3.6.0. Thanks

> Can I modify v1's witness class in instrumentation definition to make the plugin selectively started? Otherwise I can only control whether the v2 plugin starts.

You should.

> I have another problem. My local test found that using v1 plugin and kafka-client using 0.11.0.0 also appeared Magic v1 does not support record headers.

I am not familiar with that, from the codes, it seems just server side or client lib doesn't support header
Another plugin merged, please fix conflicts
Please fix conflict, we have merged a new plugin.
@aiyanbo Twitter belongs to you :) https://twitter.com/ASFSkyWalking/status/1167002935961669634
Fix conflict please, Play Framework plugin has been merged, so the ID is being used by it. Remember to change the test cases too.
Resolves #3371
/run ci

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/8/zhaoyuguang/testReport-zhaoyuguang-op_zk-2019-08-29-18-21.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/257/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-29-18-21.log)

> Here is the [test report](https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/8/zhaoyuguang/testReport-zhaoyuguang-op_zk-2019-08-29-18-21.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/257/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-29-18-21.log)

look like also support 3.5.x, so I also add it in `Supported-list.md`
/run ci
Integration test cases are required. Do you know how to do that?

> Integration test cases are required. Do you know how to do that?

I know I will continue to improve it tomorrow

> I know I will continue to improve it tomorrow

Take your time. And please fix the issues of verifications in old cases, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-integration-test-report#kafka. They have broken for a while.

> > I know I will continue to improve it tomorrow
> 
> Take your time. And please fix the issues of verifications in old cases, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-integration-test-report#kafka. They have broken for a while.

Okay, got it
Please check your startup logs, the table should be checked and auto-creating.

@wuxingye  All core team members have no experience with this. So we decided to accept this due to no obvious harm. If someone uses this in the future, we will ping you at GitHub, hope you could help.

> @wuxingye All core team members have no experience with this. So we decided to accept this due to no obvious harm. If someone uses this in the future, we will ping you at GitHub, hope you could help.

@wu-sheng Ok, it's my pleasure
@wuxingye Look like your comment break javadoc generation, could you recheck?

> @wuxingye Look like your comment break javadoc generation, could you recheck?

@wu-sheng  I find an error and a warning, if you fell there are still mistakes, pls help me, thx
I just find out from the CI, nothing more.
Click `Details` following CI. You will have Jenkins logs, it shows the commands and logs. In the Apache, we are required to have javadoc.
It's my first PR at GitHub, i gained a lot, and i will pay attention to CI in the later work

Take your time. SkyWalking is a large ecosystem, even PMC member is not familiar all parts of the project. So, don't worry. With your further contributions, you will learn more.

And welcome to be 151th contributor of this repo.
Thank you.

> @wu-sheng I have another problem. My local test found that using v1 plugin and kafka-client using 0.11.0.0 also appeared `Magic v1 does not support record headers`.

Did you connect to V0.10.x or lower using client-0.11.0.0? As far as I know v0.11.0 uses message format V2(batch record).

> Take your time. And please fix the issues of verifications in old cases, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-integration-test-report#kafka. They have broken for a while.

This is why Kafka mirror is out date. We need to change the Mirror Host to `https://archive.apache.org/dist/kafka/${KAFKA_VERSION}/kafka_${SCALA_VERSION}-${KAFKA_VERSION}.tgz`.

> Did you connect to V0.10.x or lower using client-0.11.0.0? As far as I know v0.11.0 uses message format V2(batch record).

@dmsolr Oh, that's right, so if judging the version of kafka-clents doesn't determine whether it works or not, should the header be droppedAnd `ApiVersions.computeMaxUsableProduceMagic` mean that we can't use headers in produce?

@hanahmily  As we discussed before, we could also set SSL within JDK-JVM-Options, like this:

```bash
-Djavax.net.ssl.keyStoreType=jks
-Djavax.net.ssl.keyStore=path-to/my_keystore.jks
-Djavax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword=password
-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=path-to/my_keystore.jks
-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword=password
```

So we can choose one of these ways, through elasticsearch client code implementation or through JVM options?
@JaredTan95 Look like we need a document update at es storage section.

> Please fix conflict, we have merged a new plugin.

done
You prefer to add the JVM things you mentioned in the document, some people may be not familiar with that.

> You prefer to add the JVM things you mentioned in the document, some people may be not familiar with that.

What I mean is that, if we use JVM  options, we don't need to change the above code.
Then why should we change? Is there any difference between those two ways?
As far as I know, there should be no difference. That's why I'm just talking about which way we're going to choose.  @hanahmily  Any suggestions?

> As far as I know, there should be no difference. That's why I'm just talking about which way we're going to choose. @hanahmily Any suggestions?

If so, I really prefer to do through JVM options, just update the document. @hanahmily Do you have any particular reason to use our codes to do so?

> > As far as I know, there should be no difference. That's why I'm just talking about which way we're going to choose. @hanahmily Any suggestions?
> 
> If so, I really prefer to do through JVM options, just update the document. @hanahmily Do you have any particular reason to use our codes to do so?

I agree, code is really more complex.
@JaredTan95 One thing crosses my mind, this is useful if SkyWalking supports multiple HTTP peers, such as ES https, export https, dynamic configuration service in http.

I am not understand well what is your means.
`ApiVersions` can be witness class, because it is in every versions. The MessageFormatVersion is none of the plugins business.

> @JaredTan95 One thing crosses my mind, this is useful if SkyWalking supports multiple HTTP peers, such as ES https, export https, dynamic configuration service in http.

Exactly, that's why the default JVM SSL setting is not the best options in most practices. For operator/maintainer, if they must update Keystore file in order to add a new SSL peer, that won't be accepted. Not only the risk of failure but also it's not possible. For examples, some Keystore file is a hardware device.

> The MessageFormatVersion is none of the plugins business.

I mean computeMaxUsableProduceMagic will set the magic in the produce message is 0, but the header data needs to be in the magic of 2
I think if we delete the header we can support the old version of kafka

Not really. SW plugins nevenr change the original logic. This is Kafka's businesses. I think.

> I think if we delete the header we can support the old version of kafka

How do we can do that? We can not change the message format. (The `header` is a part of MessageFormat in your words, right?)

> JDK 11

  6.3jdk

> Not really. SW plugins nevenr change the original logic. This is Kafka's businesses. I think.
> 
> > I think if we delete the header we can support the old version of kafka
> 
> How do we can do that? We can not change the message format. (The `header` is a part of MessageFormat in your words, right?)

Sorry, I may not have made it clear, but what I meant was to stop manually adding headers to ProducerRecord in the kafka-v1 plugin

Server side is not of control, please don't consider to change message body. We just leverage existing header. If server side doesn't support it, so be it, we don't support. Plugin is easy to be removed, we don't need to worry about that. 

The point of plugin, we make sure witness is good in detecting client library version, so our interceptor works as expected, that is all.

> Server side is not of control, please don't consider to change message body

I have the same idea, so I want to remove the activity of adding headers manually in the kafka-v1 plugin.
After you removed, who covers v1 use case? I haven't read codes, just have context you discuss here. Header is required to make trace continued.

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.springframework.kafka.core.KafkaTemplate$$Lambda$1286/692688374 cannot be cast to org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.EnhancedInstance
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.kafka.v1.KafkaProducerInterceptor.beforeMethod(KafkaProducerInterceptor.java:66)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.InstMethodsInter.intercept(InstMethodsInter.java:82)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.KafkaProducer.doSend(KafkaProducer.java)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.KafkaProducer.send(KafkaProducer.java:803)
	at org.springframework.kafka.core.DefaultKafkaProducerFactory$CloseSafeProducer.send(DefaultKafkaProducerFactory.java:444)

When I use kafka-clients-0.11.0.3 through kafkaTemplate and use callback, it will cause this error. Do you know the reason? I have no idea. @dmsolr

@stalary This seems Spring Kafka is adding something new, so it breaks the type cast. Only the SkyWalking instrumented class implement `EnhancedInstance` dynamically. If you want to fix this, that is another issue.

> @stalary This seems Spring Kafka is adding something new, so it breaks the type cast. Only the SkyWalking instrumented class implement `EnhancedInstance` dynamically. If you want to fix this, that is another issue.

Ok, now I upgrade the kafka cluster to 0.11.0.1, and use kafka-clients-2.0.1 test. It seems that the kafka-v1 plugin only has problems with consumption interception (2.0 updates the method), but there is no problem with production, so I plan to modify the kafka-v1 plug-in for compatibility, instead of writing kafka-v2 plugin.
Moreover, I think https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2720 is also caused by the old version of kafka cluster, so we need to modify the document to explain it
